l1smooth¶

Module: l1smooth¶

This module has utilities to take a score function, add the smoothed LASSO penalty and create a new callable that evalutes this new function and its gradient.

This related to p.136, or (4.1) in the reference below.

References¶

Nesterov, Y. “Smooth minimization of non-smooth functions.” Math. Program. 103 (2005), no. 1, Ser. A, 127–152.

Candes, NESTA (TODO: add reference)

Functions¶

regreg.l1smooth.l1smooth(gradf, M, epsilon, l1=1, Ainfo=None, f=None)¶
Take a tuple (f, gradf) and return the smoothed (f_epsilon, gradf_epsilon) as well as the new Lipschitz constant. We assume the prox function in the dual $d_2(x)=|x|^2_2$ so $sigma_2=1$.
Parameters :

gradf : callable

This evaluates $

abla f(x)$. It should take one argument of shape (p,). :

M : np.float

This is a Lipschitz constant for the $

abla f$. :

epsilon : np.float

Smoothing parameter in (4.1).

l1 : np.float

Parameter that we will multiply A by for the $ell_1$ penalty.

Ainfo : (np.float, np.float)

A tuple (A, A_12) where A is the matrix corresponding to the $ell_1$ penalty we will use and A_12 is its operator norm. If not supplied, defaults to (np.identity(p), 1).

f : callable

This evaluates $f(x)$. It should take one argument of shape (p,). If present, then the smoothed version of $f$ is returned.
Returns :

gradf_epsilon : callable

The gradient $

abla f_{epsilon}$, of the smoothed function :

with parameter epsilon.

L_epsilon : np.float

A Lipschitz constant of $

abla f_{epsilon}$. :

f_epsilon : callable

If $f$ is supplied as an argument, the smoothed function $f_{epsilon}$ is returned.
regreg.l1smooth.u_eps(x, epsilon, l1)¶

epsilon-Huberized l1*ell-1 norm.
